meanings.definition: The quality or fact of being greater in number, quantity, or importance.
meanings.sent1: In the debate, the preponderancies of evidence supported the defendant's innocence.
meanings.sent2: The preponderancies of votes favored the incumbent mayor.
meanings.sent3: The preponderancies of cupcakes at the party disappeared in record time.
meanings.sent4: Her preponderancies of kindness overwhelmed everyone she met.
meanings.sent5: The preponderancies of stars in the night sky took my breath away.

meanings.definition: The state of having superior weight, force, or influence.
meanings.sent1: The preponderancies of the elephant made it impossible to move.
meanings.sent2: His preponderancies in the company made him a respected leader.
meanings.sent3: The preponderancies of the cake on the table tempted everyone at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her preponderancies in the argument silenced all opposition.
meanings.sent5: The preponderancies of the storm clouds darkened the sky ominously.

meanings.definition: The condition of being predominant or dominant.
meanings.sent1: The preponderancies of the lion in the jungle kept other animals at bay.
meanings.sent2: The preponderancies of technology in our lives are undeniable.
meanings.sent3: The preponderancies of the sun in the sky made it a scorching day.
meanings.sent4: Her preponderancies in the dance competition earned her the first prize.
meanings.sent5: The preponderancies of the waterfall's roar drowned out all other sounds.
